current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To amend the Securities Investor Protection Act of 1970 to confirm that a customer’s net equity claim is based on the customer’s last statement and that certain recoveries are prohibited, to change how trustees are appointed, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Restoring Main Street Investor Protection and Confidence Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Restoring Main Street Investor Protection and Confidence Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Securities Investor Protection Act of 1970 amendments

header.#text: Net equity based on last statement

text.#text: A claim for a commodity futures contract received, acquired, or held in a portfolio margining account pursuant to a portfolio margining program approved by the

header.#text: Treatment of certain commodity futures contracts

text.#text: In determining net equity under this paragraph, accounts held by a customer in separate capacities shall be deemed to be accounts of separate customers.

header.#text: Treatment of accounts held by a customer in separate capacities

text.#text: the information contained in the last statement issued by the debtor to the customer before the filing date; and
any additional written confirmations of the customer’s positions, options, contracts, or indebtedness received after such last statement but before the filing date.

In determining net equity under this paragraph, the positions, options, and contracts of a customer reported to the customer as held by the debtor, and any indebtedness of the customer to the debtor, shall be determined based on—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , if the books and records of the debtor indicate that the net value of a customer’s positions, options, and contracts reported to the customer as held by the debtor, and any indebtedness of the customer to the debtor, is greater than the net value of the customer as calculated under

using the customer’s last statement, then the determination of the net equity of the customer under this paragraph shall be done using the books and records of the debtor instead of the customer’s last statement.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 8 of the Securities Investor Protection Act of 1970

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, a trustee may not recover any property transferred by the debtor to a customer before the filing date unless, at the time of such transfer, such customer—
knew the debtor was involved in fraudulent activity with respect to any customer of the debtor which reasonably indicated a fraud adversely affecting a substantial number of customers; or
was a person that—
was, or was required to be, registered—
as a broker or dealer under the

text.#text: knew, or, due to the activities of such person causing such person to be described under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or law enforcement personnel that the debtor was involved in such fraudulent activity.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: from recovering property transferred by a debtor to a person who is not a customer of the debtor.

text.#text: If the court issues a protective decree under

A trustee may not be appointed under this paragraph if the trustee is currently serving as trustee for the liquidation of the business of another debtor under this Act.
